snippet: At two Indian plantations, workers said their overseers treated them harshly and denied them basic benefits, despite promises of better working and living conditions.
abstract: Workers on India's tea plantations are subject to poor working and living conditions, despite promises of improvement from Amalgamated Plantations, which assumed control of tea estates in 2008; Human Rights Institute releases report on company's operations, which employs more than 30,000 people, mostly from tribal populations, on 24 plantations in Assam and West Bengal; report outlines grim portrait of dilapidated housing, hazardous conditions and denial of basic benefits.
lead_paragraph: At two Indian plantations, workers said their overseers treated them harshly and denied them basic benefits, despite promises of better working and living conditions.

headline.main: Hopes, and Homes, Crumbling on Indian Tea Plantations
headline.print_headline: Hopes, and Homes, Crumbling on Indian Tea Plantations
